title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, interest fostering open welcoming community, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, nationality. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery Personal attacks Trolling insulting/derogatory comments Public private harassment Publishing ’s private information, physical electronic addresses, without explicit permission unethical unprofessional conduct Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. adopting Code Conduct, project maintainers commit fairly consistently applying principles every aspect managing project. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct may permanently removed project team. Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project maintainer andy.teucher@gmail.com, sam.albers@gmail.com, stephhazlitt@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. Maintainers obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.3.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/3/0/ project created using bcgovr package.

title: Get Started with bcdata
text: bcdata::bcdc_browse() let’s access B.C. Data Catalogue web interface directly R—opening catalogue search page default browser: know catalogue “human-readable” record name permanent ID can open directly record web page:
code: ## Take me to the B.C. Data Catalogue home page bcdc_browse() ## Take me to the B.C. Winery Locations catalogue record using the record name bcdc_browse("bc-winery-locations")  ## Take me to the B.C. Winery Locations catalogue record using the record permanent ID bcdc_browse("1d21922b-ec4f-42e5-8f6b-bf320a286157")

title: Get Started with bcdata
text: bcdc_search() let’s search records B.C. Data Catalogue, returning search results R session. Let’s search catalogue records contain word “recycling”: can set number records returned search /can customize search using catalogue search facets license_id, download_audience, res_format, sector, organization: can see valid values catalogue search facets using bcdata::bcdc_search_facets(): Finally, can retrieve metadata single catalogue record using record name permanent ID bcdc_get_record(). advised use permanent ID rather human-readable name non-interactive situations—like scripts—guard future name changes record:
code: ## Give me the catalogue search results for 'recycling' bcdc_search("recycling") #> List of B.C. Data Catalogue Records #> Number of records: 3 #> Titles: #> 1: Tire Stewardship BC Tire Recycling Data (csv) #>  ID: f791329b-c2dc-4f82-9993-209780f2a1c6 #>  Name: tire-stewardship-bc-tire-recycling-data #> 2: BC FIRST Tire Recycling Data 1991-2006 (csv) #>  ID: a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686 #>  Name: bc-first-tire-recycling-data-1991-2006 #> 3: Environmental Protection Information Resources e-Library (other) #>  ID: dae0f2c3-b4f4-4d16-a96d-d7fe7c1581f3 #>  Name: environmental-protection-information-resources-e-library #>  #> Access a single record by calling `bcdc_get_record(ID)` with the ID from the desired #>  record. ## Give me the first catalogue search result for 'recycling' bcdc_search("recycling", n = 1) #> List of B.C. Data Catalogue Records #> Number of records: 1 #> Titles: #> 1: Tire Stewardship BC Tire Recycling Data (csv) #>  ID: f791329b-c2dc-4f82-9993-209780f2a1c6 #>  Name: tire-stewardship-bc-tire-recycling-data #>  #> Access a single record by calling `bcdc_get_record(ID)` with the ID from the desired #>  record.  ## Give me the catalogue search results for 'recycling' where the ## data is licenced under Open Government Licence – British Columbia bcdc_search("recycling", license_id = "2") #> List of B.C. Data Catalogue Records #> Number of records: 1 #> Titles: #> 1: BC FIRST Tire Recycling Data 1991-2006 (csv) #>  ID: a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686 #>  Name: bc-first-tire-recycling-data-1991-2006 #>  #> Access a single record by calling `bcdc_get_record(ID)` with the ID from the desired #>  record. ## Valid values for search facet 'license_id' bcdc_search_facets(facet = "license_id") #>         facet count                                             display_name name #> 1  license_id    66                           Statistics Canada Open Licence   21 #> 2  license_id     1               Queen's Printer Licence - British Columbia   25 #> 3  license_id    12                      Open Government Licence – TransLink   48 #> 4  license_id    13 Open Government Licence – Municipality of North Cowichan   44 #> 5  license_id     5    Open Government Licence – Industry Training Authority   50 #> 6  license_id     3                 Open Government Licence - Destination BC   43 #> 7  license_id    61                         Open Government Licence - Canada   24 #> 8  license_id  1590               Open Government Licence - British Columbia    2 #> 9  license_id     2                  Open Government Licence - BC Assessment   47 #> 10 license_id     4                   Open Data Licence for ICBC Information   49 #> 11 license_id     2 Open Data Commons - Public Domain Dedication and Licence   45 #> 12 license_id    15                           Elections BC Open Data Licence   42 #> 13 license_id  1433                                              Access Only   22 ## Give me the catalogue record metadata for `bc-first-tire-recycling-data-1991-2006` bcdc_get_record("a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686") #> B.C. Data Catalogue Record: BC FIRST Tire Recycling Data 1991-2006 #> Name: bc-first-tire-recycling-data-1991-2006 (ID: a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686) #> Permalink: https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686 #> Licence: Open Government Licence - British Columbia #> Description: Financial Incentives for Recycling Scrap Tires (FIRST) collection and #>  recycling data (tonnes) from 1991 to 2006. In 2007 [Tire Stewardship #>  BC](http://www.tsbc.ca/), a not for profit society, launched the new scrap tire #>  recycling program replacing the government-run program that had been in place since #>  1991. Tire Stewardship BC collection and recycling data is available #>  [here](https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/f791329b-c2dc-4f82-9993-209780f2a1c6). #> Available Resources (1): #>  1. BC FIRST Tire Recycling Data 1991-2006 (csv) #> Access the full 'Resources' data frame using: #>  bcdc_tidy_resources('a29ad492-29a2-44b9-8693-d27a8cc8e686')

title: Get Started with bcdata
text: located B.C. Data Catalogue record data want, can use bcdata::bcdc_get_data() download read data record. can use record name, permanent ID result bcdc_get_record(). Let’s look B.C. Highway Web Cameras data: catalogue record can one multiple data files—“resources”. one resource, bcdc_get_data() return resource default, bc-highway-cams example. multiple data resources need specify resource want. Let’s look catalogue record contains multiple data resources—BC Schools - Programs Offered Schools: see two data files resources available record, need tell bcdc_get_data() one want. used interactively, bcdc_get_data() prompt list available resources bcdata ask select resource want. resource ID data set available metadata record ☝️: Alternatively, can retrieve full details available resources given record data frame using bcdc_tidy_resources(): bcdc_get_data() also detect data resource geospatial file, automatically reads returns sf object R session. Let’s get air zones British Columbia:  Note: bcdata package supports downloading file types, including zip archives. best identify read data zip files, however multiple data files zip, data files bcdata doesn’t know import, fail.

Data Catalogue Record: BC Schools - Programs Offered in Schools #> Name: bc-schools-programs-offered-in-schools (ID: b1f27d1c-244a-410e-a361-931fac62a524) #> Permalink: https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/b1f27d1c-244a-410e-a361-931fac62a524 #> Licence: Open Government Licence - British Columbia #> Description: BC Schools English Language Learners, French Immersion, Francophone, Career #>  Preparation, Aboriginal Support Services, Aboriginal Language and Culture, Continuing #>  Education and Career Technical Programs offered in BC schools up to 2013/2014. #> Available Resources (2): #>  1. ProgramsOfferedinSchools.txt (txt) #>  2. ProgramsOfferedinSchools.xlsx (xlsx) #> Access the full 'Resources' data frame using: #>  bcdc_tidy_resources('b1f27d1c-244a-410e-a361-931fac62a524') ## Get the txt data resource from the `bc-schools-programs-offered-in-schools` ## catalogue record bcdc_get_data("b1f27d1c-244a-410e-a361-931fac62a524", resource = 'a393f8cf-51ec-42c6-8449-4cea4c75385c') #> # A tibble: 16,152 × 24 #>    Data Le…¹ Schoo…² Facil…³ Publi…⁴ Distr…⁵ Distr…⁶ Schoo…⁷ Schoo…⁸ Has E…⁹ Has C…˟ Has E…˟ Has L…˟ #>    <chr>     <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #>  1 SCHOOL L… 2005/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Sparwo… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  2 SCHOOL L… 2006/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Sparwo… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  3 SCHOOL L… 2007/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Sparwo… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  4 SCHOOL L… 2005/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  5 SCHOOL L… 2006/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  6 SCHOOL L… 2007/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  7 SCHOOL L… 2008/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  8 SCHOOL L… 2009/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #>  9 SCHOOL L… 2010/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #> 10 SCHOOL L… 2011/2… STANDA… BC Pub… 005     Southe… 005010… Jaffra… NA      TRUE    NA      NA      #> # … with 16,142 more rows, 12 more variables: `Has Prog Francophone` <lgl>, #> #   `Has Any French Immersion Prog` <lgl>, `Has Any French Prog` <lgl>, #> #   `Has Aborig Supp Services` <lgl>, `Has Other Appr Aborig Prog` <lgl>, #> #   `Has Aborig Lang And Cult` <lgl>, `Has Continuing Ed Prog` <lgl>, #> #   `Has Distributed Learn Prog` <lgl>, `Has Career Prep Prog` <lgl>, `Has Coop Prog` <lgl>, #> #   `Has Apprenticeship Prog` <lgl>, `Has Career Technical Prog` <lgl>, and abbreviated variable #> #   names ¹​`Data Level`, ²​`School Year`, ³​`Facility Type`, ⁴​`Public Or Independent`, … ## Get a data frame of data resources for the `bc-schools-programs-offered-in-schools` ## catalogue record bcdc_tidy_resources("b1f27d1c-244a-410e-a361-931fac62a524") #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   name                          url               id    format ext   packa…¹ locat…² wfs_a…³ bcdat…⁴ #>   <chr>                         <chr>             <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #> 1 ProgramsOfferedinSchools.txt  http://www.bced.… a393… txt    txt   b1f27d… catalo… FALSE   TRUE    #> 2 ProgramsOfferedinSchools.xlsx http://www.bced.… 1e34… xlsx   xlsx  b1f27d… catalo… FALSE   TRUE    #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​package_id, ²​location, ³​wfs_available, ⁴​bcdata_available ## Find the B.C. Air Zones catalogue record bcdc_search("air zones", res_format = "geojson") #> List of B.C. Data Catalogue Records #> Number of records: 1 #> Titles: #> 1: British Columbia Air Zones (shp, kml, geojson) #>  ID: e8eeefc4-2826-47bc-8430-85703d328516 #>  Name: british-columbia-air-zones #>  #> Access a single record by calling `bcdc_get_record(ID)` with the ID from the desired #>  record.  ## Get the metadata for the B.C. Air Zones catalogue record bc_az_metadata <- bcdc_get_record("e8eeefc4-2826-47bc-8430-85703d328516")  ## Get the B.C. Air Zone geospatial data bc_az <- bcdc_get_data(bc_az_metadata, resource = "c495d082-b586-4df0-9e06-bd6b66a8acd9")  ## Plot the B.C. Air Zone geospatial data with ggplot() bc_az %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf() +   theme_minimal()

title: Get Started with bcdata
text: Many geospatial data sets B.C. Data Catalogue available Web Feature Service. bcdc_get_data() retrieve geospatial data , sometimes geospatial file large—slow download—/may want data. bcdc_query_geodata() let’s query catalogue geospatial data available Web Feature Service using select filter functions (just like dplyr. bcdc::collect() function returns bcdc_query_geodata() query results sf object R session. Let’s get Capital Regional District boundary B.C. Regional Districts geospatial data—whole file takes 30-60 seconds download need one polygon, save time:  vignette Querying Spatial Data bcdata provides full demonstration use bcdata::bcdc_query_geodata() fine tune Web Feature Service request geospatial data B.C. Data Catalogue.
code: ## Find the B.C. Regional Districts catalogue record bcdc_search("regional districts administrative areas", res_format = "wms", n = 1) #> List of B.C. Data Catalogue Records #> Number of records: 1 #> Titles: #> 1: Regional Districts - Legally Defined Administrative Areas of BC (multiple, xlsx, wms, #>  kml) #>  ID: d1aff64e-dbfe-45a6-af97-582b7f6418b9 #>  Name: regional-districts-legally-defined-administrative-areas-of-bc #>  #> Access a single record by calling `bcdc_get_record(ID)` with the ID from the desired #>  record.  ## Get the metadata for the B.C. Regional Districts catalogue record bc_regional_districts_metadata <- bcdc_get_record("d1aff64e-dbfe-45a6-af97-582b7f6418b9")  ## We can see in the search results, and in the metadata record, that this record has a `"wms"` ## resource format, indicating that it is available as a Web Feature Service and thus ## we can query it using `bcdc_query_geodata()`  ## Have a quick look at the geospatial columns to help with filter or select bcdc_describe_feature(bc_regional_districts_metadata) #> # A tibble: 21 × 5 #>    col_name                 sticky remote_col_type local_col_type column_comments                    #>    <chr>                    <lgl>  <chr>           <chr>          <chr>                              #>  1 id                       TRUE   xsd:string      character       <NA>                              #>  2 LGL_ADMIN_AREA_ID        TRUE   xsd:decimal     numeric        "An operationally-generated uniqu… #>  3 ADMIN_AREA_NAME          FALSE  xsd:string      character      "The authoritative, officially ap… #>  4 ADMIN_AREA_ABBREVIATION  FALSE  xsd:string      character      "A short form or commonly-known a… #>  5 ADMIN_AREA_BOUNDARY_TYPE FALSE  xsd:string      character      "BOUNDARY TYPE is a high-level gr… #>  6 ADMIN_AREA_GROUP_NAME    FALSE  xsd:string      character      "The name given to the larger adm… #>  7 CHANGE_REQUESTED_ORG     FALSE  xsd:string      character      "The government acronym of the Mi… #>  8 UPDATE_TYPE              FALSE  xsd:string      character      "A short description of the lates… #>  9 WHEN_UPDATED             FALSE  xsd:date        date           "The date and time the record was… #> 10 MAP_STATUS               FALSE  xsd:string      character      "That the digital map has been ap… #> # … with 11 more rows  ## Get the Capital Regional District polygon from the B.C. Regional ## Districts geospatial data my_regional_district <- bcdc_query_geodata(bc_regional_districts_metadata) %>%   filter(ADMIN_AREA_NAME == "Capital Regional District") %>%   collect()  ## Plot the Capital Regional District polygon with ggplot() my_regional_district  %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf() +   theme_minimal()

title: Querying Spatial Data with bcdata
text: purposes example, let’s consider greenspace layer catalogue. layer described : recognize WFS-enabled geospatial data, means can make use bcdc_query_geodata. Since interested “Park” data can subset query: see greatly reduces number features dealing (correspondingly amount data needs transferred web). Remember also still actually requested full data set. just still preview. Also query still includes municipal parks BC want ones three school districts - polygons defined districts object. find subset parks can make use built-geometric operators allow us perform spatial operations remotely fine tuning query even . using INTERSECTS function appropriate since last tuning step, can call collect assign name object. requests can sometimes take quite long: Plotting filtered parks data district polygons reveals important consideration using bcdata:  example, many parks contained within school districts included districts_parks object. rather full intersection, bcdata draws bounding box around polygons intersection (case district) intersection based bounding box. behaviour imposed Web Feature Server controlled via bcdata.max_geom_pred_size option (See ?bcdc_options default values). Using example, can check see size districts object exceeded current value bcdata.max_geom_pred_size: Drawing bounding box illustrates point:  left two options get around problem. First, can simply additional processing sf package. Specifically can use spatial join assign parks respective district:  second approach set internal option (bcdata.max_geom_pred_size) increase threshold bounding box drawn. Options set R like : value bcdata.max_geom_pred_size set conservatively requests Web Feature Service consistently successful. Increasing value may result invalid requests. Finally, address original question school district municipal park space can calculate area park polygon sum areas school district:
code: bcdc_get_record("6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da") #> B.C. Data Catalogue Record: Local and Regional Greenspaces #> Name: local-and-regional-greenspaces (ID: 6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da) #> Permalink: https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da #> Licence: Open Government Licence - British Columbia #> Description: This dataset contains spatial and attribute information for local and #>  regional greenspaces in British Columbia. Local and regional greenspaces are municipal #>  or regional district lands designated by local government agencies and managed for #>  public enjoyment, ecosystem or wildlife values. Spatial boundaries were sourced from #>  municipal and regional district web sites, which in some cases provide datasets under #>  Open Government Licence, and in other cases, publicize parks and greenspaces on web maps #>  or pdf maps. Boundaries were edge-matched to the ParcelMap BC cadastre.  This spatial #>  layer contains multipart polygons. #> Available Resources (2): #>  1. WMS getCapabilities request (wms) #>  2. LocalRegionalParksAttributeValues (xlsx) #> Access the full 'Resources' data frame using: #>  bcdc_tidy_resources('6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da') #> Query and filter this data using: #>  bcdc_query_geodata('6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da') bcdc_query_geodata("6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da") #> Querying 'local-and-regional-greenspaces' record #> • Using collect() on this object will return 8555 features and 19 fields #> • At most six rows of the record are printed here #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 19 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 1228935 ymin: 455032.1 xmax: 1236528 ymax: 471352 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> #   ²​PARK_NAME, ³​PARK_TYPE, ⁴​PARK_PRIMARY_USE, ⁵​REGIONAL_DISTRICT, ⁶​MUNICIPALITY, ⁷​CIVIC_NUMBER, #> #   ⁸​CIVIC_NUMBER_SUFFIX, ⁹​STREET_NAME, ˟​LATITUDE, ˟​LONGITUDE bcdc_query_geodata("6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da") %>%   filter(PARK_PRIMARY_USE == "Park") #> Querying 'local-and-regional-greenspaces' record #> • Using collect() on this object will return 4251 features and 19 fields #> • At most six rows of the record are printed here #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 19 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 1228935 ymin: 455032.1 xmax: 1238850 ymax: 468825.5 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   id         LOCAL…¹ PARK_…² PARK_…³ PARK_…⁴ REGIO…⁵ MUNIC…⁶ CIVIC…⁷ CIVIC…⁸ STREE…⁹ LATIT…˟ LONGI…˟ #>   <chr>        <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 WHSE_BASE…      30 Blumse… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey     3536 <NA>    Rosema…    49.1   -123. #> 2 WHSE_BASE…      31 Bob Ru… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey     5448 <NA>    148 St     49.1   -123. #> 3 WHSE_BASE…      32 Bog Pa… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey     9740 <NA>    130 St     49.2   -123. #> 4 WHSE_BASE…      33 Bonacc… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey    14962 <NA>    98 Ave     49.2   -123. #> 5 WHSE_BASE…      37 Freedo… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey    15452 <NA>    84 Ave     49.2   -123. #> 6 WHSE_BASE…      46 Barnst… Local   Park    Metro … Surrey     9998 <NA>    Lyncea…    49.2   -123. #> # … with 8 more variables: WHEN_UPDATED <date>, WEBSITE_URL <chr>, LICENCE_COMMENTS <chr>, #> #   FEATURE_AREA_SQM <dbl>, FEATURE_LENGTH_M <dbl>, OBJECTID <int>, SE_ANNO_CAD_DATA <chr>, #> #   geometry <MULTIPOLYGON [m]>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​LOCAL_REG_GREENSPACE_ID, #> #   ²​PARK_NAME, ³​PARK_TYPE, ⁴​PARK_PRIMARY_USE, ⁵​REGIONAL_DISTRICT, ⁶​MUNICIPALITY, ⁷​CIVIC_NUMBER, #> #   ⁸​CIVIC_NUMBER_SUFFIX, ⁹​STREET_NAME, ˟​LATITUDE, ˟​LONGITUDE districts_parks <- bcdc_query_geodata("6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da") %>%   filter(PARK_PRIMARY_USE == "Park") %>%   filter(INTERSECTS(districts)) %>%   collect() #> The object is too large to perform exact spatial operations using bcdata. #> Object size: 948576 bytes #> BC Data Threshold: 500000 bytes #> Exceedance: 448576 bytes #> See ?bcdc_check_geom_size for more details #> A bounding box was drawn around the object passed to INTERSECTS and all features within the box will be returned. bcdc_check_geom_size(districts) #> The object is too large to perform exact spatial operations using bcdata. #> Object size: 948576 bytes #> BC Data Threshold: 500000 bytes #> Exceedance: 448576 bytes #> See ?bcdc_check_geom_size for more details districts_parks_join <- districts_parks %>%   st_join(districts, left = FALSE) options("bcdata.max_geom_pred_size" = {object size in bytes}) districts_parks_join %>%   mutate(area = st_area(geometry)) %>%   st_set_geometry(NULL) %>%   group_by(SCHOOL_DISTRICT_NAME) %>%   summarise(total_area = sum(area)) %>%   arrange(total_area) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   SCHOOL_DISTRICT_NAME total_area #>   <chr>                     [m^2] #> 1 Prince George         11793481.

what: A note about using local R functions in constructing filter queries
title: Querying Spatial Data with bcdata
text: Suppose now want find parks within 1km school districts interested . can use sf::st_buffer() make buffer around districts object, intersect greenspaces data. Note st_buffer() needs executed R computer, create buffered area sent WFS server perform INTERSECT query remotely. tell filter() evaluate piece code locally wrapping local() call:
code: greenspaces_around <- bcdc_query_geodata("6a2fea1b-0cc4-4fc2-8017-eaf755d516da") %>%   filter(INTERSECTS(local(st_buffer(districts, 1000)))) %>%   collect()

title: Querying Spatial Data with bcdata

title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: Silviculture data British Columbia largely collected stored Reporting Silviculture Updates Land Status Tracking System (RESULTS) database—including information management openings, disturbances, silviculture activities obligation declarations required Forest Range Practices Act. RESULTS data sets publically available B.C. Data Catalogue Open Government Licence - British Columbia.

title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: Western larch identified tree species well-adapted projected future climates northern British Columbia. 2013, forest policy developed allowed foresters plant western larch outside natural range climate change adaptation silviculture measure.

what: How much western larch has been planted in the Prince George Natural Resource District?
title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: Let’s use bcdata package search, retrieve explore RESULTS silviculture data answer question.

title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: start, let’s load bcdata package. also load dplyr ggplot2 packages help us work data. can learn dplyr package ggplot2 package :
code: library(bcdata) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)

title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: can gather data need answer question using RESULTS - silviculture forest cover dataset. First, let’s take look metadata record using bcdc_get_record(): see Web Feature Service-enabled geospatial data set–list data resources includes WMS getCapabilities request–can query retrieve geospatial data set using bcdc_query_geodata(): query shows data set many features 150 fields. feature treatment unit within harvested opening, contains information leading five tree species present treatment unit, including stems per hectare, age, height. Note queried data set far—data set large (~1GB) download efficiently. , let’s use filter() bcdc_query_geodata() refine query collect data import R.
code: # Get the metadata using the human-readable record name bcdc_get_record("results-forest-cover-silviculture") #> B.C. Data Catalogue Record: RESULTS - Forest Cover Silviculture #> Name: results-forest-cover-silviculture (ID: 258bb088-4113-47b1-b568-ce20bd64e3e3) #> Permalink: https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/258bb088-4113-47b1-b568-ce20bd64e3e3 #> Licence: Open Government Licence - British Columbia #> Description: RESULTS opening's forest cover poylgons with silviculture component #>  provided.  Current forest cover subimssion into RESULTS must contain attribute and map #>  information.  However, there are historical forest cover polygon infomration where maps #>  are not available.  Forest Cover is provided at three critical milestones of at #>  harvesting, at regeneration, and at free growing.  This is a part o fthe Silviculture #>  and Land Status Tracking dataset, which includes tracking achievement of silviculture #>  obligations on Crown Land #> Available Resources (1): #>  1. WMS getCapabilities request (wms) #> Access the full 'Resources' data frame using: #>  bcdc_tidy_resources('258bb088-4113-47b1-b568-ce20bd64e3e3') #> Query and filter this data using: #>  bcdc_query_geodata('258bb088-4113-47b1-b568-ce20bd64e3e3') # title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: address question, need treatment data (1) Prince George Natural Resource District (2) contain western larch. First, can use bcdata package download spatial boundary Prince George Natural Resource District—DPG ORG_UNIT Prince George Natural Resource District: Let’s plot spatial object double check need:  Now spatial object can use bounding box filter download records RESULTS - silviculture layer Prince George Natural Resource District. need download treatments western larch planted. can use bcdc_describe_feature() helper function examine column names types layer. case, want keep rows five S_SPECIES_CODE_* columns contain "LW", code western larch.
code: ## Create a spatial feature object named dpg dpg <- bcdc_query_geodata("natural-resource-nr-district") %>%   filter(ORG_UNIT=="DPG") %>% # filter for Prince George Natural Resource District   collect() # and collect the data dpg %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf() +   theme_minimal() # Make a vector of tree species we are interested in # (in this case only LW for western larch) spp_list = c("LW")  # Query and filter the data layer trees_dpg <-   bcdc_query_geodata("258bb088-4113-47b1-b568-ce20bd64e3e3") %>%   filter(INTERSECTS(dpg)) %>% #filter for records that are within the DPG boundary   filter(       S_SPECIES_CODE_1 %in% spp_list |  #filter for LW records       S_SPECIES_CODE_2 %in% spp_list |       S_SPECIES_CODE_3 %in% spp_list |       S_SPECIES_CODE_4 %in% spp_list |       S_SPECIES_CODE_5 %in% spp_list   ) %>%   collect() #collect/download the data

title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: Let’s look dimensions now much manageable data object downloaded B.C. Data Catalogue: can see several treatment units planted western larch, can make quick map harvested openings Prince George Natural Resource District:  can also create quick descriptive summaries data, treating geospatial attribute table data frame R, answer original question—much western larch planted Prince George Natural Resource District?
code: dim(trees_dpg) #> [1] 212 160 trees_dpg %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = dpg, fill = NA) + #add the DPG spatial boundary   theme_minimal()

what: What is the size and age distribution of larch plantations in the Prince George Natural Resource District in the year 2020?
title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
code: trees_dpg %>%   mutate(age = 2020 - REFERENCE_YEAR + S_SPECIES_AGE_1) %>% #create a plantation age column   ggplot() +  #start a plot   aes(x = age, y = FEATURE_AREA_SQM/10000) + #convert feature area to hectares   geom_bar(stat = "sum") +   scale_x_continuous(name = "Stand Age (years)",                      limits = c(2, 30),                      breaks = seq(from = 5, to = 30, by = 5)) +   labs(y = "Sum Treatment Unit Area (ha)",        title = "Area Planted with Western Larch by Stand Age\nin Prince George Natural Resource District",        caption = paste0("Data sourced from the B.C. Data Catalogue\n on ",                         Sys.Date(),                         " using the bcdata R package")) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

what: What is the Biogeoclimatic Ecosystem Classification (BEC) distribution of western larch plantations in the Prince George Natural Resource District?
title: Exploring Silviculture Data with bcdata
text: can download British Columbia biogeoclimatic (BEC) data B.C. Data Catalogue using bcdata join existing trees_dpg geospatial dataset using st_join function sf package. can learn sf . Now, can summarize area planted western larch biogeoclimatic unit:
code: library(sf) #load the sf package  # Load the BEC data for Prince George Natural Resource District # Load the BEC data for Prince George Natural Resource District bgc_dpg <- bcdc_query_geodata("WHSE_FOREST_VEGETATION.BEC_BIOGEOCLIMATIC_POLY") %>%   filter(BBOX(dpg, crs = "EPSG:3005")) %>% #note filtering with a BoundingBox   collect()  # Join the BEC data with our tress_dpg geospatial data set trees_bec_dpg <- trees_dpg %>%   st_join(bgc_dpg[, "MAP_LABEL"]) #join BEC data for each polygon trees_bec_dpg %>%   group_by(MAP_LABEL) %>% # group polygons by biogeoclimatic unit   summarise(Area = sum(FEATURE_AREA_SQM)/10000) %>%   ggplot() +   aes(x = MAP_LABEL, y = Area) +   geom_col() +   labs(y = "Sum Treatment Unit Area (ha)",        x = "Biogeoclimatic Unit",        title = "Area Planted with Western Larch by Biogeoclimatic Unit\nin Prince George Natural Resource District",        caption = paste0("Data sourced from the B.C. Data Catalogue\n on ",                         Sys.Date(),                         " using the bcdata R package")) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: bcdata: Search and Retrieve Data from the BC Data Catalogue — bcdata-package
text: Search, query, download tabular 'geospatial' data British Columbia Data Catalogue (https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/). Search catalogue data records based keywords, data licence, sector, data format, B.C. government organization. View metadata directly R, download many data formats, query 'geospatial' data available via B.C. government Web Feature Service ('WFS') using 'dplyr' syntax.

Data Catalogue Record: New Homes #>  Registry (2016-2021) #> Name: new-homes-registry-2016-2021- #>  (ID: 8620ce82-4943-43c4-9932-40730a0255d6) #> Permalink: #>  https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/8620ce82-4943-43c4-9932-40730a0255d6 #> Licence: Access Only #> Description: This dataset contains #>  information from BC Housing's New Homes Registry. #> Available Resources (1): #>  1. New Homes Registrations 2016-2021 (xlsx) #> Access the full 'Resources' data frame using: #>  bcdc_tidy_resources('8620ce82-4943-43c4-9932-40730a0255d6')  ## bcdc_read_functions let's us know that bcdata ## uses readxl::read_excel to import xlsx files try(  bcdc_read_functions() ) #> # A tibble: 11 × 3 #>    format  package fun       #>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     #>  1 kml     sf      read_sf   #>  2 geojson sf      read_sf   #>  3 gpkg    sf      read_sf   #>  4 gdb     sf      read_sf   #>  5 fgdb    sf      read_sf   #>  6 shp     sf      read_sf   #>  7 csv     readr   read_csv  #>  8 txt     readr   read_tsv  #>  9 tsv     readr   read_tsv  #> 10 xlsx    readxl  read_xlsx #> 11 xls     readxl  read_xls   ## bcdata let's you know that this resource has ## multiple worksheets try(  bcdc_get_data('8620ce82-4943-43c4-9932-40730a0255d6') ) #> Reading the data using the read_xlsx function from the readxl package. #>  #> This .xlsx resource contains the following sheets:  #>  'Notes' #>  'Single Detached ' #>  'Multi Unit Homes' #>  'Purpose Built Rental' #> Defaulting to the 'Notes' sheet. See ?bcdc_get_data for examples on how to specify a sheet. #> # A tibble: 0 × 0  ## we can control what is read in from an excel file ## using arguments from readxl::read_excel try(   bcdc_get_data('8620ce82-4943-43c4-9932-40730a0255d6', sheet = 'Regional Districts') ) #> Reading the data using the read_xlsx function from the readxl package. #>  #> This .xlsx resource contains the following sheets:  #>  'Notes' #>  'Single Detached ' #>  'Multi Unit Homes' #>  'Purpose Built Rental' #> Error : Reading the data set failed with the following error message: #>  #>   Error: Sheet 'Regional Districts' not found #>  #> The file can be found here: #>   '/tmp/Rtmps4O0q2/bcdata_1efc22f5781/file1efc203d3e28.xlsx' #> if you would like to try to read it manually. #>  # }

title: Show a single B.C. Data Catalogue record — bcdc_get_record
text: id human-readable name, permalink ID, URL record. advised use permanent ID record rather human-readable name guard future name changes record. use human-readable name warning issued per session. can silence warnings altogether setting option: options("silence_named_get_record_warning" = TRUE) - can put .Rprofile file option persists across sessions.

what: Retrieve options used in bcdata, their value if set and the default value. — bcdc_options
title: Retrieve options used in bcdata, their value if set and the default value. — bcdc_options
text: function retrieves bcdata specific options can set. options can set using option({name option} = {value option}). default options purposefully set conservatively hopefully ensure successful requests. Resetting options may result failed calls data catalogue. Options R reset every time R re-started. See examples addition ways restore initial state.

title: Retrieve options used in bcdata, their value if set and the default value. — bcdc_options
code: bcdc_options()

title: Retrieve options used in bcdata, their value if set and the default value. — bcdc_options
text: bcdata.max_geom_pred_size maximum size bytes object used geometric operation. Objects bigger value bounding box drawn apply geometric operation simpler polygon. bcdc_check_geom_size function can used assess whether given spatial object exceed value option. Users can iteratively try increase maximum geometric predicate size see bcdata catalogue accepts request. bcdata.chunk_limit option useful dealing large data sets. requesting large objects catalogue, request broken smaller chunks recombined downloaded. called "pagination". bcdata using option can set size chunk requested. faster internet connections, bigger chunk limit useful slower connections, advisable lower chunk limit. Chunks must less 10000. bcdata.single_download_limit maximum number records object can forcing paginated download (see entry bcdata.chunk_limit details pagination). Tweaking option conjunction bcdata.chunk_limit can often resolve failures large complex downloads. default 10000 records.

title: Retrieve options used in bcdata, their value if set and the default value. — bcdc_options
code: # \donttest{ ## Save initial conditions try(   original_options <- options() )  ## See initial options try(   bcdc_options() ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   option                       value default #>   <chr>                        <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 bcdata.max_geom_pred_size       NA  500000 #> 2 bcdata.chunk_limit              NA    1000 #> 3 bcdata.single_download_limit 10000   10000  try(   options(bcdata.max_geom_pred_size = 1E6) )  ## See updated options try(   bcdc_options() ) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   option                         value default #>   <chr>                          <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 bcdata.max_geom_pred_size    1000000  500000 #> 2 bcdata.chunk_limit                NA    1000 #> 3 bcdata.single_download_limit   10000   10000  ## Reset initial conditions try(  options(original_options) ) # }

what: Get preview map from the B.C. Web Map Service — bcdc_preview
title: Get preview map from the B.C. Web Map Service — bcdc_preview
text: Note return actual map features, rather opens image preview layer Leaflet map window

title: Get preview map from the B.C. Web Map Service — bcdc_preview
code: bcdc_preview(record)

title: Get preview map from the B.C. Web Map Service — bcdc_preview
text: record either bcdc_record object (result bcdc_get_record()), character string denoting name ID resource (URL) BC Geographic Warehouse (BCGW) name. advised use permanent ID record BCGW name rather human-readable name guard future name changes record. use human-readable name warning issued per session. can silence warnings altogether setting option: options("silence_named_get_data_warning" = TRUE) - can set .Rprofile file option persists across sessions.

title: Get preview map from the B.C. Web Map Service — bcdc_preview

what: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
title: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
text: Queries features B.C. Web Feature Service. See bcdc_tidy_resources() - resource value "wms" format column available Web Feature Service, can query download using bcdc_query_geodata(). response paginated number features number set bcdata.single_download_limit option. Please see bcdc_options() defaults information.

code: bcdc_query_geodata(record, crs = 3005)

title: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
text: record either bcdc_record object (result bcdc_get_record()), character string denoting name ID resource (URL) BC Geographic Warehouse (BCGW) name. advised use permanent ID record BCGW name rather human-readable name guard future name changes record. use human-readable name warning issued per session. can silence warnings altogether setting option: options("silence_named_get_data_warning" = TRUE) - can set .Rprofile file option persists across sessions. crs epsg code coordinate reference system. Defaults 3005 (B.C. Albers). See https://epsg.io.

title: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
text: bcdc_promise object. object includes information required retrieve requested data. order get actual data sf object, need run collect() bcdc_promise.

title: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
text: Note function actually return data, rather object class bcdc_promise, includes information required retrieve requested data. order get actual data sf object, need run collect() bcdc_promise. allows refining call bcdc_query_geodata() filter() /select() statements pulling actual data sf object collect(). See examples.

title: Query data from the B.C. Web Feature Service — bcdc_query_geodata
code: # \donttest{ # Returns a bcdc_promise, which can be further refined using filter/select: try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("bc-airports", crs = 3857) )  # To obtain the actual data as an sf object, collect() must be called: try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("bc-airports", crs = 3857) %>%     filter(PHYSICAL_ADDRESS == 'Victoria, BC') %>%     collect() )  try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("groundwater-wells") %>%     filter(OBSERVATION_WELL_NUMBER == "108") %>%     select(WELL_TAG_NUMBER, INTENDED_WATER_USE) %>%     collect() )  ## A moderately large layer try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("bc-environmental-monitoring-locations") )  try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("bc-environmental-monitoring-locations") %>%     filter(PERMIT_RELATIONSHIP == "DISCHARGE") )   ## A very large layer try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("terrestrial-protected-areas-representation-by-biogeoclimatic-unit") )  ## Using a BCGW name try(   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("WHSE_IMAGERY_AND_BASE_MAPS.GSR_AIRPORTS_SVW") ) # }

title: Search the B.C. Data Catalogue — bcdc_search
code: bcdc_search(   ...,   license_id = NULL,   download_audience = "Public",   res_format = NULL,   sector = NULL,   organization = NULL,   n = 100 )

title: Search the B.C. Data Catalogue — bcdc_search
text: ... search terms license_id type license (see bcdc_search_facets("license_id")). download_audience download audience (see bcdc_search_facets("download_audience")). Default "Public" res_format format resource (see bcdc_search_facets("res_format")) sector sector government data comes (see bcdc_search_facets("sector")) organization government organization manages data (see bcdc_search_facets("organization")) n number results return. Default 100

title: Search the B.C. Data Catalogue — bcdc_search
text: list containing records match search

title: CQL Geometry Predicates — cql_geom_predicates
text: Functions construct CQL expression used filter results bcdc_query_geodata(). See geoserver CQL documentation details. sf object automatically converted bounding box reduce complexity Web Feature Service call. Subsequent -memory filtering may needed achieve exact results.

title: CQL Geometry Predicates — cql_geom_predicates
code: EQUALS(geom)  DISJOINT(geom)  INTERSECTS(geom)  TOUCHES(geom)  CROSSES(geom)  WITHIN(geom)  CONTAINS(geom)  OVERLAPS(geom)  BBOX(coords, crs = NULL)  DWITHIN(   geom,   distance,   units = c("meters", "feet", "statute miles", "nautical miles", "kilometers") )

title: CQL Geometry Predicates — cql_geom_predicates
text: geom sf/sfc/sfg bbox object (sf package) coords coordinates bounding box four-element numeric vector c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax), bbox object sf package (result running sf::st_bbox() sf object), sf object gets converted bounding box fly. crs (Optional) numeric value string containing SRS code. coords bbox object non-empty crs, taken . (example, 'EPSG:3005' just 3005. default use CRS queried layer) distance numeric value distance tolerance units units distance specified . One "feet", "meters", "statute miles", "nautical miles", "kilometers"

text: Filter query Web Feature Service using dplyr methods. filtering accomplished lazily full sf object read memory collect() called. See dplyr::filter details.

title: Filter a query from bcdc_query_geodata() — filter.bcdc_promise
text: .data object class bcdc_promise (likely passed bcdc_query_geodata()) ... Logical predicates filter results. Multiple conditions combined &. rows condition evaluates TRUE kept. Accepts normal R expressions well special CQL geometry functions WITHIN() INTERSECTS(). know CQL want write CQL query directly, write enclosed quotes, wrapped CQL() function. e.g., CQL("ID = '42'"). filter expression contains calls need executed locally, wrap local() force evaluation R request sent server.

title: Filter a query from bcdc_query_geodata() — filter.bcdc_promise
code: # \donttest{ try(   crd <- bcdc_query_geodata("regional-districts-legally-defined-administrative-areas-of-bc") %>%     filter(ADMIN_AREA_NAME == "Cariboo Regional District") %>%     collect() )  try(   ret1 <- bcdc_query_geodata("fire-perimeters-historical") %>%     filter(FIRE_YEAR == 2000, FIRE_CAUSE == "Person", INTERSECTS(crd)) %>%     collect() )  # Use local() to force parts of your call to be evaluated in R: try({   # Create a bounding box around two points and use that to filter   # the remote data set   library(sf)   two_points <- st_sfc(st_point(c(1164434, 368738)),                      st_point(c(1203023, 412959)),                      crs = 3005)    # Wrapping the call to `st_bbox()` in `local()` ensures that it   # is executed in R to make a bounding box that is then sent to   # the server for the filtering operation:   res <- bcdc_query_geodata("local-and-regional-greenspaces") %>%     filter(BBOX(local(st_bbox(two_points, crs = st_crs(two_points))))) %>%     collect() }) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() #> is TRUE # }

title: bcdata 0.4.0
text: WFS queries constructed using bcdc_query_geodata(), function calls filter() need evaluated locally -longer auto-detected. now need wrapped local() force local evaluation CQL query constructed sent WFS server. Please see vignette("local-filter") information. aligns recommended usage patterns dbplyr backends (#304, PR #305).

title: bcdata 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-06 Fixed test failing internet available Upgraded dbplyr edition 2, bumped dependency 2.0.0 (#300)

title: bcdata 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-24 Added bcdc_get_citation generate bibliographic entries (via utils::bibentry) individuals records. #273 Results bcdc_search() (objects class "bcdc_recordlist") now print 50 records default, instead 10. addition, new [ method "bcdc_recordlist" objects, allowing subset lists still nice printout (#288). Ensure bcdc_get_data() fails informatively given resource doesn’t exist record (#290) Ensure compatibility upcoming dbplyr 2.2.0 (#297, 82b9defa376ab)

title: bcdata 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-28 BC Data Catalogue API updated, requiring changes bcdata package, internal (#283). mostly invisible user, except removal type search facet bcdc_search() bcdc_search_facets(). use API key (authorized catalogue editors ), need login new catalogue get updated key set value BCDC_KEY environment variable new key.

title: bcdata 0.3.0
text: Add names method bcdc.promise objects. can now call names object produced bcdc_query_geodata. handy trying figure exact column spelling etc. #278

title: bcdata 0.3.0
text: Fix bug sticky column incorrectly identified bcdc_describe_feature (#279)

title: bcdata 0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-04 Code .onLoad() sent request wfs getCapabilities endpoint cause package fail load. moved internal function bcdc_get_capabilities() makes request first time ’s required, stores result remainder session (#271) testthat now used conditionally run tests testthat package installed.

title: bcdata 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-24

title: bcdata 0.2.3
text: Setting bcdata.single_download_limit limit dynamically getCapabilities endpoint. #256 bcdc_describe_feature now joins object description column returned object provide information field directly R. #241, #259 Better documentation information surrounding bcdata.max_geom_pred_size option. #243, #258 Add new function bcdc_check_geom_size users can check prior submitting WFS request filter see request require bounding box conversion. #243, #258 Better documentation messaging paginated requests required bcdc_query_geodata(). #240, #264 Better documentation print method records suitable use bcdc_query_geodata(). #265, #267

title: bcdata 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-12

title: bcdata 0.2.2
text: Added bcdc_list_groups bcdc_list_group_records provide ability query group endpoint catalogue API. #234 Added new option bcdata.single_download_limit enable setting maximum number records object can forcing paginated download (#252)

title: bcdata 0.2.2
text: Fixed bug collect.bcdc_promise wrong parameter name crul::Paginator$new() resulted error paginated wfs requests (#250, thanks @meztez) Fixed bug name bcdata.chunk_limit option typo, actually used properly (#252)

title: bcdata 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-25

title: bcdata 0.2.1
text: Remove link pipe documentation simplicity. Fixed bug using many . functions (e.g., .Date(), .character(), .numeric()) filter statement fail. (#218, #219)

title: bcdata 0.2.1
text: Updated internal SQL translation use DBI S4 generics (DBI::dbQuoteIdentifier() now used instead dbplyr::sql_escape_ident() DBI::dbQuoteString() instead dbplyr::sql_escape_string()), comply upcoming dbplyr 2.0 release (#225, #225; https://github.com/tidyverse/dbplyr/issues/385) Wrapped examples call web resources try() avoid spurious check failures (#229).

title: bcdata 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-25

title: bcdata 0.2.0
text: Rename selectable column bcdc_describe_feature sticky modify corresponding docs tests (#180).

title: bcdata 0.2.0
text: Add explore-silviculture-data-using-bcdata vignette/article. h/t @hgriesbauer Add head tail methods bcdc.promise objects. Thanks @hgriesbauer suggestion! (#182, #186) Provide as_tibble alias collect line dbplyr behaviour (#166) Geometry predicates can now take bbox object well sf* object (#176) reading excel files, bcdc_get_data now outputs messages indicating presence names sheets (#190) bcdc_get_data() & bcdc_query_geodata() now work full B.C. data catalogue url including resource (#125, #196) bcdc_sf objects now time_downloaded attribute Authorized B.C. Data Catalogue editors can now authenticate catalogue setting BCDC_KEY environment variable catalogue API token (https://github.com/bcgov/bcdata#bcdc-authentication; #208).

title: bcdata 0.2.0
text: Fix select, filter mutate roxygen bcdata specific documentation methods available Add tests attributes

title: bcdata 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-17

title: bcdata 0.1.2
text: Add bcdc_tidy_resources retrieving data frame containing metadata resources single B.C. Data Catalogue record (PR#149, #147) Add decorative record print method (#73) reliable detection layer name wfs call bcdc_query_geodata() (#129, #138, #139) Add mutate method bcdc_promise fails suggest alternative approach. (PR#134) Add back querying vignette Using tidyselect select.bcdc_promise behaviour typical dplyr::select ($140, #138) Using GitHub actions CI.

title: bcdata 0.1.2
text: Remove BEYOND() RELATE() geometry predicates currently fully supported geoserver

title: bcdata 0.1.2
text: Now precompiling vignettes queries submitted locally actually requests made CRAN (#151) Fix NOTE: Namespace Imports field imported : ‘methods’ error CRAN (#145) Fixed bug functions nested inside geometry predicates evaluated (#146, #154) Fixed bug DWITHIN wasn’t working units needed unquoted (#154) Fixed bug BBOX() used filter() statement combined bcdc_query_geodata() work (#135, #137, #131) Fixed bug layer names number work bcdc_query_geodata() (#126, #127)

title: bcdata 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-11-05 Expand standardize checking w[ms]f features make package resistant slight warehouse API changes. Data retrieval functions now work BCGW name (#106) Add CITATION file (#104) Increased test coverage (#112) Skipping tests CRAN require web connection Better informative error message experiencing http failures occur (#121) Added print methods show_query Change examples donttest Added verbose argument bcdc_get_record enable suppressing console writing

title: bcdata 0.1.0
text: Initial Release
